content: The organizers of the OpenForum Academy Symposium found our website and have invited us. In their words:

"OpenForum Europe is organising the OpenForum Academy Symposium in Boston on 13-14 November at Digital Data Design Institute at Harvard Business School. It is an academic conference that covers questions related to the social, political and economic impact of Open Source. 

We found your website Boston Open Dev for the open source meetups and we thought of sharing the invitation in case you and your networks might be interested.

Registrations are still open and we will especially appreciate if you pass the word to your connections."
I went ahead and registered, not that I'll be able to attend all of it.

I know a few of the speakers like Matt Germonprez and Sean Goggins and I'd be happy to meet people I've heard of like Hana Frluckaj (author of Gender and Participation in Open Source Software Development).
I went both days and it was really good. I'm thinking about blogging about it.

Philip Durbin said:

Ok, here's my write up: http://blog.greptilian.com/2024/11/14/ofa-symposium

Nice, lots of interesting people I see :eyes:
